author: Ward Clark
title: Harris Team Scrambles to Quietly 'Edit' Military Claims in Walz Campaign Bio â€“ RedState
text: The heat, as the late singer Glenn Frey would have put it, is on, and the Harris-Walz campaign is feeling it. Now, after several days of being hammered on Minnesota Governor and vice presidential candidate Tim Walz's heavily embellishing his military record, the campaign is responding - by quietly amending Walz's campaign bio: Sorry, but [that's too little, too late.](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/08/08/harris-walz-military-credentials-00173236) Kamala Harrisâ€™ presidential campaign updated its online biography of running mate Tim Walzâ€™s military service amid Republican efforts to question his record in the Army National Guard. On its website, the Harris campaign axed a reference to Walz as a â€œretired command sergeant majorâ€ and now says that he once served at the command sergeant major rank â€” a small change that nonetheless reflects his true rank at retirement from the Army National Guard. Walz, the governor of Minnesota, served for 24 years in the National Guard before retiring in 2005 from the military to run for the U.S. House, where he became the most senior enlisted soldier to serve in Congress. That's not the part that many of us veterans, combat and non-combat alike, objected to the most. See Related: [Even CNN Torches Tim Walz in Blistering Fact Check About Carrying Weapon 'In War'](https://redstate.com/nick-arama/2024/08/07/cnn-torches-tim-walz-in-blistering-fact-check-about-carrying-weapon-in-war-n2177867) [Tim Walz's Campaign Claimed He Was Going to Iraq Even As He Was in the Process of Deserting His Men](https://redstate.com/streiff/2024/08/08/tim-walzs-campaign-claimed-he-was-going-to-iraq-even-as-he-was-in-the-process-of-deserting-his-men-n2177883) The edits are, to put it bluntly, weaksauce, in that they gloss over only one part of the [objections veterans have to Walz's claims](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/08/08/harris-walz-military-credentials-00173236). In the original biography, the same sentence called Walz â€œthe son of an Army veteran and a retired Command Sergeant Major in the Army National Guard himself,â€ website archives show. A Harris campaign spokesperson did not immediately respond to a request for comment, nor did Walzâ€™s gubernatorial office in Minnesota, the website for which still describes him as â€œCommand Sergeant Major Walz.â€ Walzâ€™s campaign website for governor also used this title. There is no mention of Walz's claims about carrying "weapons of war in war": Gov.â€” Kamala HQ (@KamalaHQ) [@Tim_Walz]: I spent 25 years in the Army and I hunt. Iâ€™ve been voting for common sense legislation that protects the Second Amendment, but we can do background checks. We can research the impacts of gun violence. We can make sure those weapons of war, that I carried in war,â€¦ [pic.twitter.com/3IVaXi2RP2] [August 6, 2024] As you can see, that X post, from the Harris-Walz campaign, is still up. He never carried these "weapons of war" in war. He was never anywhere near a war. He never deployed to a designated combat zone. Gov. Walz is lying. But here's the real kicker: The lie that started Walz's political career, when he was confronted at a [protest of an appearance by then-President George W. Bush](https://www.frontpagemag.com/the-big-lie-that-launched-tim-walzs-political-career/): His challenge prompted a KGB-style interrogation that was sadly characteristic of Bush campaign events. Do you support the president? Walz refused to answer. Do you oppose the president? Walz replied that it was no oneâ€™s business but his own. (He later learned that his wife was informed that the Secret Service might arrest him.) Walz thought for a moment and asked the Bush staffers if they really wanted to arrest a command sergeant major whoâ€™d just returned from fighting the war on terrorism. Did you get that? Walz - who has never in his life been on the same continent as a war zone - described himself as a "command sergeant major who'd just returned from fighting the war on terrorism." Everything in that statement is a lie. Tim Walz is a liar. His political career began with a lie, and he's been lying ever since - and if he ever ends up as Vice President of the United States, he will continue right on lying. Fortunately, America's veterans and others will most certainly continue bringing the heat to the Harris-Walz campaign over Walz's lies: Wow - Harris campaign doesn't understand that by continuing to lie that Walz had a higher rank than he actually had, it makes it look MUCH WORSE that he abandoned his men right before an arduous combat deployment.â€” Peachy Keenan (@KeenanPeachy) If he had been lower level, it would not be such a sharpâ€¦ [August 8, 2024] The post reads: Wow - Harris campaign doesn't understand that by continuing to lie that Walz had a higher rank than he actually had, it makes it look MUCH WORSE that he abandoned his men right before an arduous combat deployment. If he had been lower level, it would not be such a sharp betrayal. But by elevating him as their boss, their COMMANDING SARGEANT MAJOR, they are actually making his ducking more humiliating!

author: Zonebourse
title: La commissaire de la FTC, Melissa Holyoak, s'inquiÃ¨te de la collecte de donnÃ©es sur les enfants par l'intelligence artificielle - Zonebourse
text:
La commissaire fÃ©dÃ©rale au commerce, Melissa Holyoak, a dÃ©clarÃ© jeudi que l'agence devrait se pencher sur la maniÃ¨re dont les produits d'intelligence artificielle utilisent les donnÃ©es qu'ils recueillent auprÃ¨s des jeunes utilisateurs, dans un contexte de prÃ©occupations liÃ©es Ã  la protection de la vie privÃ©e et Ã  la sÃ©curitÃ©. Mme Holyoak, l'une des deux rÃ©publicaines siÃ©geant Ã  la commission et qui pourrait en devenir la prÃ©sidente par intÃ©rim aprÃ¨s l'entrÃ©e en fonction du prÃ©sident Ã©lu Donald Trump en janvier, a dÃ©clarÃ© que l'agence devrait examiner l'autoritÃ© dont elle dispose pour recueillir des informations sur les pratiques de l'IA en matiÃ¨re de protection de la vie privÃ©e des enfants.
L'ancien solliciteur gÃ©nÃ©ral de l'Utah a donnÃ© l'exemple d'enfants qui utilisent les services d'IA de la mÃªme maniÃ¨re que les gÃ©nÃ©rations plus Ã¢gÃ©es se tournent vers un jouet de voyance Magic 8 Ball, en demandant "dois-je aller au bal ?".
"Qui recueille ces informations ? Qui dÃ©tient ces informations ? OÃ¹ vont ces informations ?" a dÃ©clarÃ© M. Holyoak lors d'un discours prononcÃ© Ã  l'occasion d'une rÃ©union antitrust de l'American Bar Association Ã  Washington.
La FTC applique la loi sur la protection de la vie privÃ©e des enfants en ligne (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act), qui rÃ©glemente la maniÃ¨re dont les plateformes collectent les donnÃ©es des jeunes utilisateurs, et a poursuivi TikTok pour des violations prÃ©sumÃ©es.
La FTC est sur le point d'Ãªtre secouÃ©e lorsque sa prÃ©sidente actuelle, Lina Khan, quittera ses fonctions ou sera remplacÃ©e par un successeur nommÃ© par M. Trump. La lutte de Mme Khan contre la consolidation des entreprises au nom des consommateurs a sÃ©duit les dÃ©mocrates et certains rÃ©publicains, dont le vice-prÃ©sident Ã©lu JD Vance. Mais elle s'est attirÃ© les critiques de certains membres de la communautÃ© des affaires en raison de son approche agressive.
Mme Khan a dÃ©clarÃ© qu'un examen plus approfondi des transactions dÃ©courageait les fusions qui nuiraient illÃ©galement Ã  la concurrence.
M. Holyoak a dÃ©clarÃ© que la FTC ne devait pas adopter une approche dogmatique Ã  l'Ã©gard des fusions et acquisitions.
"Notre rÃ´le n'est pas d'essayer d'empÃªcher les transactions pour les empÃªcher tout simplement", a-t-elle dÃ©clarÃ©.
Mme Holyoak a Ã©galement dÃ©clarÃ© qu'elle pensait que la FTC perdrait son appel dÃ©fendant l'interdiction de non-concurrence pour les travailleurs. Mme Holyoak n'a pas commentÃ© le soutien exprimÃ© en faveur de l'interdiction par l'ancien reprÃ©sentant amÃ©ricain Matt Gaetz, choisi par M. Trump pour occuper le poste de procureur gÃ©nÃ©ral.
"Je pense que nous pourrions tous bÃ©nÃ©ficier de l'intervention du tribunal et de la Cour suprÃªme sur cette question", a-t-elle dÃ©clarÃ©.

author: WTVG Staff
title: Details of public funeral service for Kei'Mani Latigue announced
text: TOLEDO, Ohio (WTVG) - Dale-Riggs Funeral Home announced the public memorial services for Keiâ€™Mani Latigue on Wednesday in what is expected to be a massive showing.The public is invited to honor Keiâ€™Mani with a walkthrough memorial at the West Toledo YMCA on Tremainsville Road on Friday. Itâ€™s scheduled from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.A representative with the funeral home confirmed the authenticity of the event with 13 Action News.Those interested in leaving a message of support, sharing a memory of the young girl or sending flowers for the event can do so at her obituary page here . The obituary itself was not listed late Wednesday afternoon.It comes the day after a Lucas County judge determined Keiâ€™Maniâ€™s grandmother, Dorothy Latigue, has the legal right to plan the services for the 7th grader. 13 Action News coverage on the murder of Keiâ€™Mani Latigue: Copyright 2025 WTVG. All rights reserved.

author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Vesperini attacca:: "Problemi di privacy con la posta comunale"
text:
Il capogruppo di minoranza a Grottammare critica l'indirizzamento delle email al protocollo comunale anzichÃ© ai consiglieri stessi, invocando il rispetto della privacy e la creazione di una posta ufficiale dedicata.
Sul sito comunale di Grottammare, nella sezione â€™Tutti i Politiciâ€™, le e-mail dei consiglieri di minoranza non sono considerate personali, ma vengono indirizzate e inoltrate al protocollo del Comune. Sulla questione non Ã¨ dâ€™accordo il capogruppo di â€™Grottammare cittÃ  unicaâ€™ Lorenzo Vesperini."Questo comportamento â€“ scrive nella mozione Vesperini â€“ solleva interrogativi circa la privacy e la protezione dei dati personali dei consiglieri di minoranza, che potrebbero desiderare di mantenere una certa riservatezza nelle loro comunicazioni inviate dai cittadini. Il diritto alla privacy Ã¨ un principio fondamentale sancito dalla normativa europea e nazionale in materia di protezione dei dati personali. In un contesto democratico, Ã¨ importante garantire a tutti i membri del Consiglio, indipendentemente dalla loro appartenenza politica, il rispetto per la loro privacy e la libertÃ  di comunicazione". Il capogruppo di â€™Grottammare cittÃ  unicaâ€™ invita il Consiglio a deliberare lâ€™attivazione di un servizio di posta ufficiale ad uso esclusivo di tutti i consiglieri comunali, poichÃ© la creazione di questo strumento dovrebbe rientrare nelle linee strategiche della comunicazione del comune di Grottammare.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: WOMENâ€™S SOCCERâ€™S COMEBACK BID FALLS SHORT AT IDAHO
text:
WOMENâ€™S SOCCERâ€™S COMEBACK BID FALLS SHORT AT IDAHO
The IU Indianapolis women's soccer team lost to Idaho 2-1 during their western road trip opener. After conceding two goals in the first half, the
Jaguars showed improved aggression in the second half, highlighted by a free kick goal from senior Cassie Rodriguez. Despite the loss, goalkeeper Emily Keck made five critical saves in 45 minutes, demonstrating resilience as the Jaguars pressed for an equalizer. The team continues to search for their first victory of the season, now standing at 0-3-1 as they prepare to face Montana next.
- Jaguars were outshot 17-9 overall, with a 8-6 edge in shots on goal for Idaho.
- Emily Keck recorded 5 saves in her half of play, while Cassie Rodriguez netted her 3rd career goal.
Despite the encouraging second-half performance, the Jaguars' struggles in the first half reveal ongoing challenges with their offense, particularly in creating scoring opportunities early in matches.State of Play
- The Jaguars improved their offensive intensity in the second half, generating multiple scoring chances.
- Head coach Chris Johnson emphasized the potential to build on the team's momentum despite the defeat.
IUPUI will face Montana on September 1 at 3:00 p.m. ET, aiming to capitalize on the positive aspects from their match against Idaho.Bottom Line
The Jaguars are showing resilience and fighting spirit, which could be a foundation for future success as they seek their first win of the season on the road.
Read more at
 IU Indy Athletics
